intro: Lagochilus occultiflorus, commonly known as the hidden-flower hellebore, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, often hidden among its foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
